data.title: Movies Written By Will Ferrell
data.meta_description: This is a list of films written by Will Ferrell, screenwriter. This list of movies written by Will Ferrell is alphabetical and can be sorted for other bits of ...
data.text:
This is a list of films written by Will Ferrell, screenwriter. This list of movies written by Will Ferrell is alphabetical and can be sorted for other bits of information such as who directed the film and what genre it falls under. These Will Ferrell screenplays are not unfinished works; they have all been produced and released somewhere in the world. Any unreleased Will Ferrell films are not included on this list. Will Ferrell has written some very iconic movies over the years, so if you're trying to find popular Will Ferrell films that you haven't seen already then this list is the perfect guide for doing so.

List features movies like Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy, Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby and more!

You can use this list to answer the questions, "What movies did Will Ferrell write?" and "How many movies did Will Ferrell write?"

This list includes almost all of Will Ferrell's screenplay credits. You can click on the names of the movies Will Ferrell wrote in order to find out more about each individual Will Ferrell film. Trailers for each movie can also be seen if you click on the video previews for these Will Ferrell films. {#nodes}

Will Ferrell, Chris Kattan, Molly Shannon

Released : 1998

Directed by : John Fortenberry, Amy Heckerling

In the film A Night at the Roxbury, Steve (Will Ferrell) and Doug Butabi (Chris Kattan) are dim-witted brothers whose dream is to party at the exclusive Roxbury club. The comedy genre flick sees these two nightclub enthusiasts perpetually fail in their attempts, only succeeding after a fortuitous encounter with Richard Grieco (played by himself). A mishap leads to an invitation into the glitzy world they've always admired from afar. However, as they taste fame and fortune, their brotherly bond is tested, revealing a heartwarming undercurrent beneath the hilarity.

Will Ferrell, Christina Applegate, Paul Rudd

Released : 2004

Directed by : Adam McKay

Hotshot television anchorman Ron Burgundy (Will Ferrell) welcomes upstart reporter Veronica Corningstone (Christina Applegate) into the male-dominated world of 1970s broadcast news -- that is, until the talented female journalist begins to outshine Burgundy on air. Soon he grows jealous, begins a bitter feud with Veronica and eventually makes a vulgar slip on live TV that ruins his career. However, when an outrageous story breaks at the San Diego Zoo, Ron may get a chance to redeem himself.

Dear Woman

Will Ferrell, Will Forte, Nick Kroll

Released : 2011

Directed by : Matt Villines, Osmany Rodriguez

Dear Woman is a 2011 short comedy film directed by Osmany Rodriguez and Matt Villines.

Good Cop, Baby Cop

Will Ferrell, Adam McKay, Chris Henchy

Released : 2007

Directed by : Adam McKay

Good Cop, Baby Cop is a 2007 short film comedy directed by Adam McKay.

Will Ferrell, David Koechner

Directed by : Adam McKay

Will Ferrell, John C. Reilly, Richard Jenkins

Released : 2008

Directed by : Adam McKay

In Step Brothers, Brennan Huff (Will Ferrell) and Dale Doback (John C. Reilly) are two middle-aged, jobless men still living with their single parents. Life takes an unexpected twist when their parents, Nancy (Mary Steenburgen) and Robert (Richard Jenkins), fall in love and decide to marry, forcing the pair to become step brothers. Initially at odds, the duo gradually forms an unlikely friendship as they navigate through a series of hilarious misadventures. Their juvenile antics, however, threaten to break apart their newly formed family unless they grow up. This comedy film is marked by its humorous take on adult immaturity and familial relationships.
